image.altText: A smiling woman with two children, their faces pixelated

props.synopsis: Ballarat locals are being encouraged to reach out for help as they struggle to process the disappearance of Samantha Murphy and arrest of a local man.

title.children: Grief over Samantha Murphy is complicated by arrest of local man, Ballarat mayor says

image.altText: a table of photos of Samantha and flowers.

props.synopsis: The Ballarat community has gathered for a vigil to honour Samantha Murphy after a 22-year-old man was charged with her alleged murder.

title.children: Ballarat community gather to support the family of missing mother Samantha Murphy

image.altText: The back of a Victoria Police officer on duty.

props.synopsis: A woman aged in her 20s, who was armed with a knife, has been shot dead by police after officers responded to reports of a woman assaulting another woman in the north-east suburb of Lower Plenty.

title.children: Police shoot woman dead while responding to fatal assault in Melbourne

image.altText: A red sign with white writing that says 'rent' in capital letters that obscures a weatherboard house in the background.

props.synopsis: New data confirms what most renters already know — there has not been a worse time to be a tenant in at least the past 17 years.

title.children: Rental affordability has gone from record highs to record lows in the space of three years. What went wrong?

image.altText: the sun behind clouds creates orange and yellow glow during sunrise at Storm Bay in Tasmania

props.synopsis: The calendar rolls into autumn but Australia's weather still firmly resembles mid-summer, including the most intense autumn heatwave in decades across South Australia and Victoria.

title.children: Near-record autumn heat bakes south-east while cyclone threat returns to Australia's north

image.altText: A man with long hair smiling

props.synopsis: The man charged with murdering Victorian woman Samantha Murphy can be revealed as Patrick Orren Stephenson, after his lawyer dropped a bid to have the 22-year-old's name suppressed.

title.children: Patrick Orren Stephenson named as Samantha Murphy's accused killer after suppression order ends

image.altText: Anwar Ibrahim and Anthony Albanese stand next to each other, solemnly looking out into the distance

props.synopsis: Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim shared his thoughts on topics from China to Shakespeare while in Australia.

title.children: Does Australia need to adopt a 'more mature' approach to China?

image.altText: A compilation of images including a picture a young Palestinian woman and a map of southern Gaza

props.synopsis: Jumana is just one of many young people trapped inside Gaza. For months she has documented her family's attempt to escape to safety. This is her story.

title.children: Jumana's desperate journey shows how more than half of Gaza fell into a state of ruin

image.altText: A close up of Kate Middleton smiling while wearing dangly earings.

props.synopsis: For centuries, the British monarchy has shrouded itself in mystery while allowing the occasional glimpse over palace walls. But when the star royal wanted to convalesce in private, some of her future subjects revolted.

title.children: How palace intrigue, internet conspiracies and The Crown fed the frenzied speculation over Kate's health

image.altText: A man stands in a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal a new star witness has come forward alleging one of the men accused of bikie heavyweight Shane Bowden's murder claimed while behind bars he was paid for his alleged role in the killing.

title.children: Details emerge of alleged jailhouse confession over the killing of bikie Shane Bowden

image.altText: Earthquake near Blue Mountains

props.synopsis: The earthquake occurred 9 kilometres beneath the surface in the Blue Mountains National Park near Warragamba at about 8:53pm, according to Geoscience Australia.

title.children: Earthquake of 3.6-magnitude hits Blue Mountains area west of Sydney

image.altText: A Carlton AFL player pumps his fist in celebration after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: Carlton come from 46 points down to beat the Brisbane Lions at the Gabba in an incredible Opening Round encounter, as both teams suffer injuries to key players.

title.children: Lions star suffers suspected ACL tear as Blues complete historic comeback at the Gabba

image.altText: A greeny blue channel between white capped waves breaking into the shore.

props.synopsis: Rips are the number one coastal hazard contributing to a number of deaths each year so how do you spot one and what should you do if you're caught in one?

title.children: What is a rip at the beach and how do you safely swim out of one?

image.altText: A woman with glasses and long curly grey hair sits on a couch flanked by her 3 husky dogs

props.synopsis: Kerry gave up all hope of being reunited with her beloved pets after years of insecure housing, but her story has a happy ending. Animal rescue shelters say they are at capacity amid a competitive rental market and cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: 'To have my dogs back is everything': Woman reunites with pets after years of insecure housing

image.altText: A cupcake with green icing, upside down and a bit smashed, on the floor

props.synopsis: "Count Her In!" was the theme for yesterday's International Women's Day, and this year Australian womanhood had the chance to leaf through the newly released pay gap data over their celebratory cupcakes, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: A spicy new ingredient gave rise to some awkward morning teas in corporate Australia

image.altText: Aavaisha is wearing a white dress and getting her makeup done with bright pink eyeshadow

props.synopsis: Nine First Nations designers and artists with wearable garments are showing their new collections at the Melbourne Fashion Festival this weekend.

title.children: Can anyone wear First Nations fashion? Designers have their say

image.altText: A Fiji minister stands next to a flag.

props.synopsis: In the same week a prominent female Fiji MP was demoted after an alleged affair, two Solomon Islands female MPs announced they would not be contesting next month's election. The kicker? They'd be replaced by their husbands.

title.children: Two female MPs in the Pacific have been replaced by their husbands, with another demoted for alleged affair

image.altText: A person in a spacesuit kneels on the surface of the moon.

props.synopsis: Leaving Earth for long periods requires highly specialised technical skills, but you also need to handle isolation, confined quarters and team conflict.

title.children: Mars travel will resemble being stuck in an elevator with the same people for years. Would you do it?

image.altText: ECQ logo on an envelope for a postal vote.

props.synopsis: With so many councillor and mayor positions uncontested, is it a sign of voter disengagement or are people happy with how things are?

title.children: It's a well-paid job so why are fewer people nominating for local councils?

image.altText: A before and after shot showing a close-up of Jayden Vilardi before and after he had eight veneers fitted to his top teeth.

props.synopsis: Jayden Vilardi recently spent $21,000 on dental veneers to fix his smile and confidence. He says he did not rush into it and was told of the risks — but there are concerns many others are being enticed by persuasive advertising.

title.children: Fixing a smile can fix someone's confidence, but there are fears patients are being lured into cosmetic work

image.altText: Kyle Chalmers Adelaide coach Peter Bishop

props.synopsis: Elite swimming coach Peter Bishop has been stood down from his position with the South Australian Sports Institute following an investigation, leaving Olympic champion Kyle Chalmers with a coaching change just 140 days out from the Paris Games.

title.children: Olympian Kyle Chalmers's coach stood down months out from the Paris Games

image.altText: Man leaves court holding woman's hand while reporters ask questions

props.synopsis: Michael Burbidge has been fined $15,000 for destroying Chris "Willow" Wilson's phone after the Netflix star's death in a helicopter crash in February 2022, as details of the crash aftermath are made public for the first time.

title.children: Pilot sentenced for destroying evidence after chopper crash that killed Netflix star

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Composite of Oppenheimer, Barbie, and Poor Things.

props.synopsis: From Oppenheimer to Poor Things, which films will win the big awards at Hollywood's night of nights? Our experts cast their votes.

title.children: Who can pick the 2024 Oscar winners more accurately — a film critic or a mathematician?

image.altText: Sam Kerr looks ahead during a 2023 Women's World Cup match.

props.synopsis: The governing body has been in touch with Sam Kerr, while appealing for respect for the court proceedings surrounding the Matildas captain's case.

title.children: Football Australia reaffirms support for Kerr amid racial harassment allegations

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: The State of the Union address rolls around every year, but for US President Joe Biden, the stakes of this speech couldn't have been higher. These were the big moments.

title.children: When Biden got up to make a high stakes speech, he decided to address the elephant in the room

image.altText: A neon outline of the Asia Pacific region.

props.synopsis: 'Happiness' brain chips, a missing jumbo jet and genuine fears of a conflict with North Korea — here's what happened in the Asia Pacific this week.

title.children: A brain chip to make you happy and fears of a war with North Korea — this week in the Asia Pacific

image.altText: A composite of a  tree-lined dirt track extending away into the bush, and a thin smiling woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A social media movement honouring Victorian woman, Samantha Murphy, who was allegedly murdered, is picking up speed across Australia.

title.children: Runners push themselves to finish the run Samantha Murphy couldn't as part of social media campaign

image.altText: A groupd of Indigenous women are holding big bright signs that say Yes 23

props.synopsis: This International Women's Day, three women reflect on the good and bad of the modern workplace.

title.children: Do you feel uncomfortable at work? You might be suffering from 'identity strain'

image.altText: A fire truck is parked near a bus that has mounted the sidewalk.

props.synopsis: A pedestrian has died after a bus crashed into a building in Brisbane's CBD during peak hour this afternoon.

title.children: Woman dies after bus crashes into building in Brisbane CBD during peak hour

image.altText: A man celebrates after winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Storm produces an effort for the ages to down Penrith 8-0 and send an early warning to the rest of the competition.

title.children: Melbourne holds Panthers scoreless to keep 22-year winning streak alive, as Warriors count cost of loss to Sharks

image.altText: Carlos Sainz in a red jacket, walking through an F1 paddock.

props.synopsis: The Spaniard, who finished third in last weekend's season opener in Bahrain, will be replaced by Ferrari reserve driver Oliver Bearman.

title.children: Sainz diagnosed with appendicitis and is out of F1 grand prix

image.altText: Alastair Clarkson

props.synopsis: The AFL sanctions North Melbourne coach Alastair Clarkson, describing his abuse of St Kilda players Jimmy Webster and Dougal Howard during a preseason match as "highly inappropriate".

title.children: Clarkson fined $20,000, handed suspended ban after 'unacceptable' verbal abuse

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf speaks after hearing into unlawful termination

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission hearing into Antoinette Lattouf's dismissal from the ABC hears that David Anderson received "many complaints" about her that he forwarded to colleagues.

title.children: ABC received complaints about Antoinette Lattouf on her first day on air, commission told

image.altText: A woaman in a white coat with long brown hair prepares to toss a coin behind her into the Trevi Fountain

props.synopsis: For hundreds of years, when in Rome, visitors have flocked to the fountain to make a wish, following a storied ritual. Few gave their coins a second thought.

title.children: What happens to coins tossed in the Trevi fountain?
